DataElement.preferredName: Image Guided Biopsy Method Use Modality Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to type of imaging procedure used in the biopsy of tissue or fluid.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis, using imaging technology._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._To put into action or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis, using imaging technology.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis, using imaging technology.

Property.preferredDefinition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.:To put into action or service.

Concepts.definition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.
To put into action or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine.

Concepts.longName: Positron Emission Tomography and Computed Tomography Scan
Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that utilizes positron emission tomography and computed tomography in a single machine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique in which high-frequency sound waves are bounced off internal organs and the echo pattern is converted into a 2 dimensional picture of the structures beneath the transducer.

Concepts.definition: The use of high-frequency sound waves to generate images of the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
A specific manner, characteristic, pattern of application or the employment of, any therapeutic agent or method of treatment, especially involving the physical treatment of a condition.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
